Profile]</ref> | currentclub = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | clubnumber = 17 | position = {{flatlist|[[Forward (association football)#Striker|Striker]] / [[Midfielder#Winger|Winger]]}} | youthyears1 = | youthclubs1 = [[Deportivo La Guaira]] | years1 = 2013–2015 | clubs1 = [[Deportivo La Guaira]] | caps1 = 37 | goals1 = 4 | years2 = 2015–2016 | clubs2 = [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] | caps2 = 0 | goals2 = 0 | years3 = 2015–2016 | clubs3 = → [[Granada CF|Granada]] (loan) | caps3 = 9 | goals3 = 4 | years4 = 2016– | clubs4 = [[Watford F.C.|Watford]] | caps4 = 0 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2016 | clubs5 = → [[Granada CF|Granada]] (loan) | caps5 = 14 | goals5 = 1 | years6 = 2016 | clubs6 = → [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] (loan) | caps6 = 6 | goals6 = 0 | years7 = 2017–2018 |clubs7= → [[Málaga CF|Málaga]] (loan) | caps7 = 16 | goals7 = 0 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[Venezuela national under-17 football team|Venezuela U17]] | nationalcaps1 = 2 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014– | nationalteam2 = [[Venezuela national under-20 football team|Venezuela U20]] | nationalcaps2 = 8 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalyears3 = 2016– | nationalteam3 = [[Venezuela national football team|Venezuela]] | nationalcaps3 = 13 | nationalgoals3 = 0 | club-update = 12:36, 27 April 2018 (UTC) | ntupdate = 16:41, 15 October 2018 (UTC). }} '''Adalberto Peñaranda Maestre''' (born 31 May 1997) is a Venezuelan professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[Forward (association football)#Striker|striker]] or [[Midfielder#Winger|winger]] for English club [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], and the [[Venezuela national football team]].
==Club career== ===Early career=== Peñaranda (Venezuelan God) was born in El Vigía, [[Alberto Adriani Municipality]], [[Mérida (state)|Mérida]]. He is an academy graduate of [[Deportivo La Guaira]] and made his professional and [[Venezuelan Primera División|Primera División]] debuts on 11 August 2013, starting in a 1–3 home loss against [[Deportivo Táchira]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Nuevo|first=Pablo (11 August 2013)|url=http://www.eluniversal.com/deportes/torneo-apertura-2013/130811/deportivo-tachira-hizo-una-maestria-ante-el-deportivo-la-guaira|title=Deportivo Táchira hizo una "maestría" ante el Deportivo La Guaira|trans-title=Deportivo Táchira "masters" over Deportivo La Guaira|publisher=''[[El Universal (Caracas)|El Universal]]''|language=es|accessdate=22 November 2015}}</ref> Peñaranda scored his first goal as a senior on 23 February 2014, netting his team's only goal in a 1–4 loss at [[Caracas FC]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.meridiano.com.ve/futbol-venezolano/caracas-goleo-al-deportivo-la-guaira-y-comanda-el-clausura.html |title=Caracas goleó al Deportivo La Guaira y comanda el Clausura |trans-title=Caracas thrashed Deportivo La Guaira and rules ''Clausura'' |publisher=[[Diario Meridiano]] |language=es |date=23 February 2014 |accessdate=22 November 2015 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20151123080910/http://www.meridiano.com.ve/futbol-venezolano/caracas-goleo-al-deportivo-la-guaira-y-comanda-el-clausura.html |archivedate=23 November 2015 |df= }}</ref> He finished the [[2013–14 Venezuelan Primera División season]] with 18 appearances to his name, and one goal.
===The Pozzo Triangle=== ====Udinese, Granada & Watford==== On 16 June 2015, Peñaranda signed for [[Serie A]] side [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]], owned by Italian businessman [[Giampaolo Pozzo]]. He was then immediately loaned to [[Granada CF|Granada]] who at the time were also under the ownership of Pozzo.<ref>{{cite web|last=Deportes|first=Ovacion (16 June 2016)|url=http://www.el-nacional.com/deportes/Adalberto-Penaranda-cedido-Granada-Espana_0_647935356.html|title=Adalberto Peñaranda irá cedido al Granada de España|trans-title=Adalberto Peñaranda will be loaned to Granada in Spain|website=El Nacional|language=es|accessdate=22 November 2015|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20151123043108/http://www.el-nacional.com/deportes/Adalberto-Penaranda-cedido-Granada-Espana_0_647935356.html|archive-date=2015-11-23|dead-url=yes|df=}}</ref> He made his debut for the [[La Liga]] side on 22 November, starting in a 2–0 home win against [[Athletic Bilbao]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Liceras|first=Angel (22 November 2015)|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2015_16/la-liga/jornada_12/gda_ath/|title=El Granada encuentra su oficio|trans-title=Granada finds its role|website=Marca|language=es|accessdate=22 November 2015}}</ref> Upon making his debut he became the youngest ever player to ever represent the club.<ref name=Records>{{cite news|last=Slevison|first=Andrew (2 February 2016)|url=http://www.tribalfootball.com/articles/watford-loan-messi-record-breaker-penaranda-to-granada-4115526|title=Watford loan Messi record-breaker Penaranda to Granada|accessdate=15 July 2016|website=Tribal Football}}</ref> On 12 December 2015, Peñaranda scored his first goals in the top flight of Spanish football, netting a brace in a 2–1 away win against [[Levante UD]].<ref>{{cite web|last=Liceras|first=Angel (12 December 2015)|url=http://www.marca.com/eventos/marcador/futbol/2015_16/la-liga/jornada_15/lev_gda/|title=Peñaranda impulsa al Granada|trans-title=Peñaranda drives Granada|publisher=Marca|language=es|date=12 December 2015|accessdate=13 December 2015}}</ref> In doing so he became the youngest ever non-Spanish player to score a brace in La Liga, breaking the record previously held by [[FC Barcelona|Barcelona's]] [[Argentina national football team|Argentine]] forward, [[Lionel Messi]].<ref name=Records />
On 1 February of the following year he signed a four-and-a-half-year deal with [[Premier League]] side [[Watford F.C.|Watford]], owned by Pozzo's son Gino, but remained on loan at Granada for the remainder of the season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordfc.com/news/article/160201-adalberto-penaranda-watford-fc-granada-cf-premier-league-2932847.aspx|title=Official: Watford Sign Exciting Teenager Peñaranda|publisher=Watford's official website|date=1 February 2016|accessdate=1 February 2016}}</ref> At the end of the season Granada were sold to Chinese firm Link International Sports, putting pay to the possibility of Peñaranda returning to the club on loan for another season.<ref>{{cite news|last=Mail|first=Simon (15 June 2016)|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/SPORT/14557931.Watford_owner_Gino_Pozzo_sells_Granada_to_Link_International_Sports/|title=Watford owner Gino Pozzo sells Granada to Chinese firm Link International Sports|website=Watford Observer|accessdate=15 July 2016}}</ref> Following his arrival at Watford in July, Peñaranda was shipped back to [[Udinese Calcio|Udinese]] on a season long loan deal.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://udinese.it/portal/IT/handle/?hil&page=redazione_approfondimenti&vid=5708|title=Ufficiale: Penaranda e' dell'Udinese|publisher=Udinese|date=11 July 2016|accessdate=11 July 2016}}</ref> Watford had agreed to loan Peñaranda while they waited for him to qualify for a work permit to play in England.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.wdsport.co.uk/2016/10/watford-weigh-up-la-liga-return-for-adalberto-penaranda/|title=Watford weigh up La Liga return for Adalberto Penaranda|website=Watford Observer|last=Affleck|first=Kevin|date=26 October 2016|accessdate=5 January 2017}}</ref>
He made his debut for the Udinese on 13 August 2016, coming on as a second-half substitute for [[Ryder Matos]] in a 3-2 [[Coppa Italia]] loss to [[Spezia Calcio|Spezia]].<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.espnfc.com/italian-coppa-italia/story/2929344/spezia-rally-to-eliminate-top-flight-udinese-from-coppa-italia|title=Spezia rally to eliminate top-flight Udinese from Coppa Italia|website=ESPN|date=14 August 2016|accessdate=15 August 2016}}</ref> His Serie A debut came the following week in a 4-0 drubbing at the hands of [[AS Roma|Roma]], with Peñaranda coming on as a second-half substitute for [[Rodrigo De Paul]].
Peñaranda made his Watford first team debut against [[Woking FC|Woking]] in the 3rd round of the [[FA Cup]] on 6 January 2019.
====Loan to Málaga====
On 5 January 2017, it was announced that Peñaranda had been recalled from Udinese and would spend the remainder of the season on loan with La Liga side [[Málaga CF|Málaga]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.watfordobserver.co.uk/sport/watfordfc/watfordfcnews/15002563.Penaranda_makes_Malaga_move/|website=Watford Observer|title=Watford striker Adalberto Penaranda returns to Spain to join Malaga on loan|last=Matthews|first=Anthony|date=5 January 2017|accessdate=5 January 2017}}</ref> The deal included an option for Málaga to extend the loan by a further season.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://en.as.com/en/2017/01/05/football/1483571129_790679.html|title=Peñaranda: Málaga confirm loan signing of Venezuelan forward|website=AS|date=5 January 2017|accessdate=5 January 2017}}</ref>
==Career statistics==

===International=== {{updated|match played 29 March 2017.}}<ref>https://int.soccerway.com/players/adalberto-penaranda/292088/</ref>
{| class="wikitable" style="text-align: center;" |- ! National team !! Year !! Apps !! Goals |- |rowspan="2" valign="center"|[[Venezuela national football team|Venezuela]] | 2016 || 11 || 0 |- | 2017 || 1 || 0 |- ! colspan="2" | Total !! 12 !! 0 |}
==Personal life== On 18 April 2015 Peñaranda and fellow Deportivo La Guaira teammate Charlys Ortíz were both shot in an attempted robbery after attending a party. Peñaranda was struck in the left thigh with the bullet passing clean through. Ortiz, however, was struck in the rib area and had to undergo surgery the following day.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.diariorepublica.com/sucesos/fueron-heridos-de-bala-los-futbolistas-adalberto-penaranda-y-charlys-ortiz-del-deportivo-la-guaira|title=Fueron heridos de bala los futbolistas Adalberto Peñaranda y Charlys Ortíz, del Deportivo La Guaira|trans-title=The footballers Adalberto Peñaranda and Charlys Ortíz, from Deportivo La Guaira, wounded by gunfire|publisher=Diario República|language=es|date=19 April 2015|accessdate=22 November 2015}}</ref>
==Honours== ===Club=== '''Deportivo La Guaira''' *[[Copa Venezuela]]: [[2014 Copa Venezuela|2014]]
===International=== '''Venezuela U20''' *[[FIFA U-20 World Cup]]: Runner-up [[2017 FIFA U-20 World Cup|2017]]
'''Venezuela U-17''' *[[South American Under-17 Football Championship]]: Runner-Up [[2013 South American Under-17 Football Championship|2013]]
